title: Compare taking the bus to taking the subway. Which do you prefer?

korean: 오늘은 지하철 대신 버스를 타봤는데, 색다른 경험이었어.
버스 정류장에서 앱으로 버스 도착 시간 확인하는데, 진짜 편하더라.
막상 버스가 오니까 사람들이 우르르 몰려들더라고.
교통카드 찍고 타는데, 지하철보다 요금이 더 싸서 좋았어.
창가 자리에 앉아서 밖 구경하면서 가는 게 재미있었어.
지하철은 지하로만 가니까 경치를 못 보잖아.
버스는 도로 상황에 따라 시간이 달라지는 게 단점이긴 해.
운전이 좀 거칠어서 핸드폰 보다가 멀미 날 뻔했어.
그래도 평소 안 가본 길로 가니까 새로운 가게들도 보이고 좋더라.
목적지에 거의 다 왔을 때 하차벨 눌렀는데, 소리가 크게 나서 깜짝 놀랐어.
가끔은 버스 타는 것도 나쁘지 않은 것 같아, 기분 전환도 되고.
english: So today I took the bus instead of the subway, and, like, it was a different experience.
At the bus stop, I checked the bus arrival time on the app, and it was, you know, really convenient.
It said the bus would come in 5 minutes, so I, like, waited comfortably.
When the bus actually arrived, people, um, rushed in all at once.
I tapped my transit card to get on, and the fare was cheaper than the subway, which was, like, nice.
Sitting by the window and looking outside while riding was, you know, pretty fun.
The subway only goes underground, so, like, you can't see the scenery.
The downside of the bus is that, well, the time varies depending on traffic conditions.
The driving was a bit rough, so I, like, almost got motion sickness while looking at my phone.
Still, going through routes I don't usually take was nice because I saw, you know, new shops and places.
When we were almost at the destination, I pressed the stop button, and the sound was so loud it, like, startled me.
Sometimes taking the bus isn't bad, you know, it's like a change of pace.
